text:
‚ÄúThe End of the *** th World‚Äù: Season 2 is interesting and pleasant to watch, but not necessary
06 Nov 2019, 15:30 by Alexey Khromov
The critic Alexei Khromov tells how the authors of the famous series retained their beautiful shape, but missed the full depth of the plot.
Netflix released the sequel to the hit of 2017. The first season of ‚ÄúThe End of the *** th World‚Äù literally captivated the audience, presenting a very short, but eventful story about two teenage nihilists James and Alyssa who fled home. In search of the girl‚Äôs father, they broke into a strange house, killed his rapist master, encountered many scoundrels, and finally learned to trust each other. However, it ended with a fatal shot.
The story of the first season seemed complete, but the popularity of the series forced the authors to release a sequel. It will surely please fans of the aesthetics of filming, a cool soundtrack and an abundance of black humor. That's just the story itself has become easier, and the intensity of emotions subsided.
Impact story
The action of the second season takes place two years after the finale of the first. The authors maintain a good intrigue, without telling what really ended then. But they introduce a new character, which is directly related to the past actions of the heroes.



In general, the main topics of the second season are the inevitable consequences of any actions and the inevitable growing up. The past time after time overtakes the heroes, and new impulsive actions also have to be dealt with. And the characters themselves have changed: they have become more careful and prudent. It is not so easy to escape from the cafe without paying, if you know that the money will then require an innocent waitress.



Such changes create scope for new topics and experiences. But they also kill the drive that the audience loved so much. Now this is a much calmer story, where the heroes are increasingly adrift, dreaming of achieving happiness, and not just running away from problems. And all this leads to an inexplicably positive ending, from the cloying of which even a very ridiculous reference to the "Big Lebowski" does not save.
The storyline of the new character has been made the main driving force of the story, and it seems unnecessarily social and correct. Previously, "The End of the *** th World" spoke about the nihilism of adolescents who have not met a single good person in their life. Now, the focus is on toxic relationships and unhealthy affection.



Of the important advantages, only a new round of detachment remains. The relations of the heroes show how easy it is to lose the closeness to which it took so long. In the first season, the words of James and Alyssa began to coincide with their thoughts only to the finale. Now, all the main experiences again remain in the head, and even a strong desire to forgive old insults restrains everyone, hiding behind indifference.
Stunning aesthetics
Almost all the shortcomings of the plot are expertly hidden behind the visuals and the soundtrack. The continuation of ‚ÄúThe End of the *** th World‚Äù looks even more stylish than the first season.



Symmetrical frames were added to the pale color scheme, and visual contrasts only complement the plot opposites. Black and white clothes of heroes, reflections, contrasting of emotional thoughts and cold words, calm life and a terrible past - all this makes us only sharper perceive the experiences of the characters.
Torn editing with an abundance of flashbacks sometimes resembles the style of Big Little Lie by Jean-Marc Valle. In addition, the memories here are mixed with fantasies and create a distorted perception of some events.
The action is framed by a splendidly selected soundtrack, which included many songs of completely different artists: from The Kinks to the permanent composer of the series Graham Coxson from the group Blur.



The first season of ‚ÄúThe End of the *** th World‚Äù was a beautiful combination of aesthetics and rudeness. A very bold story called into question the very existence of a morality. But the authors decided to make the continuation more cautious and finally complete the story of James and Alyssa. The plot was not reasonably stretched: the second season lasts about 2.5 hours, so it simply does not have time to get bored even with a lower density of events.
Fans will enjoy the return of their favorite characters and new adventures. But after watching, many will still have the feeling that it was just superfluous. After all, a series with such a crude name does not at all need morality, sociality and an illusory happy ending. All this can not be compared with a sinking heart when you see a darkening screen after a shot on the beach.
